newsitem.title: UK: UK shares open higher, tracking Wall St rebound.
newsitem.headline: UK shares open higher, tracking Wall St rebound.

text.p: UK shares opened higher on Wednesday, reversing the bulk of yesterday's losses after a rebound in U.S. stocks and bonds as concerns eased over the threat of an imminent aggressive rise in U.S. interest rates.

An agreed 264 million stg bid by Booker for Nurdin & Peacock also helped sentiment, sending the FTSE 100 index up 22.8 points to 3,878.7 by 0738 GMT, with gaining stocks outweighing decliners by some eight to one.
Yet traders said activity was likely to be quiet ahead of today's monetary meeting between Governor of the Bank of England Eddie George and Chancellor Kenneth Clarke.
